article.headline: Pepperdine 85, San Francisco 68
article.story: SAN FRANCISCO (AP) -- Yakhouba Diawara had 22 points and 11 rebounds to help Pepperdine snap a five-game losing streak with an 85-68 victory at San Francisco on Thursday night. Alex Acker added 16 points, Glen McGowan had 14 points and nine rebounds, and Kingsley Costain scored 13 as Pepperdine (13-10, 3-5 West Coast Conference) won for the first time since beating the Dons 64-57 at home Jan. 9. John Cox scored 24 points for San Francisco (13-8, 4-4), which lost for the first time in 11 games at Memorial Gym this season. The Waves started the second half with a 12-2 run to take a 13 point lead with 14:45 remaining including two 3-pointers by Kingsley Costain. San Francisco committed costly turnovers as Pepperdine increased its lead with an assortment of 3-pointers and dunks. The Dons were outhustled in the paint and outrebounded. The best that San Francisco could do was manage a 7-0 run in the second half to cut the deficit to nine points. The Waves quickly responded on a 12-0 run taking a 21-point lead with less than seven minutes to go. San Francisco used an 8-0 run to take a 12-4 lead. Pepperdine answered with a 17-7 run to lead 21-19 with 8:52 to play in the first half. The game was close for the remainder of the half. The Waves scored the final five points of the half to take a 38-35 score into the locker room.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
